Reviews.Author: VagabondJeff
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently enjoyed a Valentine's Weekend stay at the beautiful Solage Calistoga! We have stayed at many high-end resorts but the staff at Solage is absolutely amazing! From the second we arrived till the time we exited the property, the staff could NOT have been kinder or more attentive. EVERY SINGLE ONE of the employees was so very polite and caring and never failed to greet us with a smileâ€¦morning, noon and night. We dined in the highly regarded Solbar Restaurant for breakfast all three days we were there and dinner one evening. Fabulous food! All so fresh and creatively prepared. Solbar is obviously a favorite with the locals as well so, if you go, be sure to make reservations well in advance. World-class wine tasting is literally all around the hotel. Rombauer was our favorite and just down the road from Solage. My wife decided that she is going to live there and asked me to go back to San Diego to get the dog and come back to the hotel! We could not provide a stronger recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “Can hardly wait to return”
Reviews.Author: hotelhound
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 1 night to enjoy the area as well as take a break at the spa. Everything is wonderful here --- the location, the rooms, the staff, and most importantly the spa and fitness facilities --- exactly what I wanted for my quick break. The room was luxurious even though I was in the lowest tier room. Extremely quiet and clean with a very comfortable bed and bath like a personal retreat. The spa is now one of my favorites --- the mud treatment was much nicer for me than the traditional mud bath. I loved the private sunning/relaxation areas -- it was like having my own private pool. I can hardly wait to return and am planning a romantic trip with my special someone for the spring.

Reviews.Title: “Third Visit Another Success”
Reviews.Author: JorjeJaj
Reviews.Content: Nicely located on Silverado Trail just outside of Calistoga center, Solage offers a fairly relaxing off-season environment, with all of the amenities you need. The resort was crowded during our first on-season visit and much less serene. Solage attracts a young crowd, which can occasionally get noisier than the more typical middle aged resort demographic. However, the units are spread out, and it's very peaceful in the rooms and their patios. The outdoor hot tub in our suite was a plus. Free (inclusive) wet bar was a special treat, but I don't think this applies to all rooms. Service is generally attentive, rooms are clean, and spa treatments were good to great. However, the bus boy who showed us to our rooms via bicycle, seemed to be going through the motions when describing our room amenities - perhaps because we were returning guests. Our dinner at SolBar during our second visit last year was good, though the menu tries a bit too hard to be eclectic and exotic (pork belly, etc.) - not that we haven't been exposed to various cuisines before. During our latest trip, for lack of ANY traditional offerings at SolBar, we took room service - simple burgers and fries - and it's probably the first time I've had room service fries that were crisp and not soggy upon delivery. The gym is decent sized, with maybe 10 aerobic stations w/ TV's and a good selection of weight stations. There appeared to be an active series of exercise classes as well. Solage is approaching a critical age at which it can begin to renovate and sharpen its attention to detail or let things slip. We hope they maintain the former route. But so far so good.

Reviews.Title: “great spot”
Reviews.Author: sfbaytravels
Reviews.Content: The service was great across the board- in the spa, restaurant, front desk, concierge, housekeeping... Food was fantastic in the restaurant and we ate every meal there- morning, noon, and night. We ventured into the town of Calistoga for food once and had an awful meal so figured we might as well spend the rest of the time eating well and only went to SolBar (the hotel restaurant/bar). We read other people's reviews and ordered the lemon ricotta pancakes for breakfast. Delicious ! We are from the San Francisco Bay area so we have been wine tasting a zillion times but still managed to hit a few wineries. The B winery is across the street which makes getting there from the hotel very easy. Unfortunately, most of the other decent wineries are a bit of a drive, so it was nice to be able to walk to this one from the hotel. I have only great things to say about the place, if I were trying to find something negative, I would say the room that comes with the fireplace and soaking tub were a bit of a disappointment. The fireplace is ok, the only time you can see it is if you are sitting in a chair directly in front of it, it would be nice if you could lie on the bed and be able to see it too. The soaking tub is small, room for only one, two if you squish in. So if you want to have a romantic bubble bath with champagne for two, you might be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Modern accomodations, with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Thaibunny
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in August, so the details are slightly fuzzy. From what I can remember, however,everything was perfect, and the spa was magnificent! I went with a few girlfriends, and this is the best place to go for complete relaxation and rejuvenation. The grounds are beautifully decorated, and they provide free bikes to take into the city or any of the surrounding vineyards. The pool area is beautiful, service was exceptional from the moment we checked in, to the end of our stay. The room we stayed in was a Vega Studio with two queens, each studio comes with its own semi private patio area. It was so quiet we often wondered if there was anyone else staying here with us! I love the pebble stone showers, and the fact that they refill large bottles of bath amenities. We ordered room service the first night, it was prompt and delicious. If you don't want room service, the Solbar is an excellent choice for meals, although their menu is limited, they only use fresh locally grown ingredients which is lovely. We got spa treatments, I opted for an Eminence Organic Facial which was nice but next time I think I would like to try the Kate Somerville facial. Us girls also did the mudslide treatment which was lovely, even though we had to apply the mud ourselves. We indulged on someone else's expense, so whenever I save up enough money I would definitely love to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Still love this place”
Reviews.Author: Stones7
Reviews.Content: I recently took my wife back to Solage for a second visit as a surprise treat for her birthday. It was every bit as good as we remembered it from the first time. I think the most useful thing for other TA users I can say about Solage is that whilst its not cheap (where in the Napa Valley is?), it does represent value for the money it costs compared to other Napa Valley resorts. The spa facilities, rooms and restaurant are all first class. The beds are really comfortable, and the resort is so quiet at night that you can't fail to get a good nights sleep. The service is truly excellent and attentive, without being intrusive. The concierge is knowledgable and efficient. They even loan Mercedes Benz cars to guests for free - we borrowed a convertible for cruising around the vineyards with the top down which was a lot of fun. Our only gripe about Solage is that it's so good, you don't really want to leave and go off wine tasting, or to experience the Napa Valley. You could easily spend your whole time on the property, using the pools, the spa, relaxing and eating at the excellent SolBar. But then you pay the high prices because you're in the Napa Valley, and not experiencing what the area has to offer would be a bit of a waste, so it becomes a bit of a balancing act to get the best of both worlds. Tip 1: Book the B&B rate if it's offered for the dates you're there. The breakfast at SolBar is worth it on its own, but the rate also includes use of the thermal pools too. Tip 2: The rooms are comfortable, and spacious, but the various room types are all exactly the same size, they mostly all have the same king beds (though there are some with 2 queens), same outdoor patio areas, they are all well spread out away from other guests and peacefully secluded, and all have identical amenities. The differences are that the least expensive Vega studio doesn't have a bath or fire in the room - so is actually the most spacious as a result; the next priced room, the Mira studio has a fire; and the most expensive Adara studio has both a fire and bath (there are also some suites which are the only larger room type). Depending on when you're planning on staying you may not ever use the fire, and whether you want to pay extra for the bath is up to you.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a girlfriend getaway”
Reviews.Author: katastrophe1
Reviews.Content: Had a great time at Solage with a large group of girlfriends for a birthday weekend. Lovely grounds, very clean and relaxing atmosphere. Service is great, from the spa staff to the restaurant waitstaff. There were only a few bumps in the stay, but not enough to lower the rating: We booked our girl's getaway months in advance, yet they couldn't get us into rooms that were remotely near each other. We had four people in a room, but there were only two bikes assigned to each room. Even though it looked like very few people were using them, we couldn't get any more for the group. We booked the girl's getaway package, which included the 'mudslide' treatment - interesting and fun, but i'm not sure i'd pay for it if it didn't come included. I did like that we had our own individual mud buckets rather than soaking in a tub of mud that hundreds of others had already soaked in. Room service was lightning fast - good food, but very expensive. The restaurant was great - helped that we had breakfast vouchers for $25 per person - needed considering drinks (i.e. an orange juice) was around $10. But the food is excellent and the service deserves the Michelin star that it got. Definitely a highlight.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: tobywasp
Reviews.Content: We have just spent 2 nights at the Solage and it was everything it was cracked up to be, expensive, yes, but worth the luxury. The restaurant was excellent and some of the food was the best I have ever tasted, the service very friendly and relaxed. The rooms are beautiful and peaceful, loved the shower, my only regret was not having time to sample the spa. The hotel is within walking distance of several wineries, of course you can always use the bikes provided with each room, we would recommend Clos Pegase, which also has some very interesting art exhibits and the larger Sterling winery which has some fantastic views.

Reviews.Title: “Peace and romance at a superspa”
Reviews.Author: jason10
Reviews.Content: Our son and daughter in law treated us to this most luxurious spa. Everything was perfect, from the outstanding spa environment to the thermal pool and exercise classes to the fine food and drink. The room we had was as luxurious as any we have visited, and we would return in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “wonderfull”
Reviews.Author: stephanieauburn
Reviews.Content: The pools where clean and beautiful.The resturant was outstanding,try and eat outside at night,the lights and the fire pits are beautiful.Excellent customer service thru out the resort.The cottages are modern and comfortable.Excellent stay,stephanie jenkins

Reviews.Title: “I've been around the world and have...”
Reviews.Author: uback007
Reviews.Content: I've been around the world and have frequented many wonderful hotels and resorts, however, Solage is hands down my new favorite destination! There is no better place to get lost and relax than this. Truly incredible. Pricey? A little- but worth every penny. During our 2 night stay, we never left the property. There's really no need to. World class, drinks, dining and service awaits. Did I mention the pool?? 'Nuf said :-)

Reviews.Title: “Zen like peacefulness with outstanding design and service”
Reviews.Author: Suezak10
Reviews.Content: Stayed August 24&25. Lovely well planned and executed individual cottage. Silence reigns supreme. Actually don't think I have slept so well in months. We meant to visit wineries but instead languished on our terrace and watched the hummingbirds or meandered over to the excellent restaurant to dine. The cruising bikes are a huge plus and we ended up going along many nearby lanes and seeing the vineyards up very close. I ordered ice to be delivered but they couldn't find a top for the bucket. I voiced the concern that the ice would melt and I really liked ice water to sip if I woke up. We went to dinner ,returned and there was a fresh bucket of ice for me to make it through the night.. Never needed that ice as I slept so soundly. A wonderful yet pricey resort. I think it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Every detail was worth the cost”
Reviews.Author: shrink711
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at Solage for a few days on a week long "drive up the coast" trip we took. It was a beautiful place with excellent service. The poolside service was wonderful. They serve you a large carafe of lemon water and tend to every need. I did several yoga classes that were wonderful and in a beautiful room that had an open wall that overlooked a beautiful oak tree. The food in the restaurant was amazing. I enjoyed all the details in the rooms. A coffee maker that grinds the beans, a tea maker.....and leaving a small bottle of fresh minted water at turn down was a great touch. We took advantage of the bike cruisers and rode into the little town of Calistoga each morning for coffee and even to some of the closer vineyards. We will definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing resort”
Reviews.Author: wackymuttley
Reviews.Content: Let me preface by saying that I normally go solo on spa resort excursions. This being a family vacation meant that total self-indulgence was out and family together time was the order of the day. And with an 8 year old in tow, there were definitely other considerations as well. My worry was that the place would be too high end for the type of relaxing casual family escape we were looking for, but a friend of mine who had been there before assured me otherwise. The first good vibe was the conversation I had with the lady assisting with the spa reservations. She didnâ€™t have that curt used to catering to elites only type demeanor â€“ she was very nice and patient with my questions. So I was at least able to book my 50 minutes of â€˜meâ€™ time : ) From the moment we arrived, everyone from the front desk to the rest of the staff was very welcoming. My daughter was zipping a refreshing drink when I walked back to the car from check in, and the gentleman who brought our luggage in was quite easy going which quickly put us at ease. We had the opportunity to stay at the Capella suite for our one night stay in Calistoga and upon first inspection, the furnishings and the layout was definitely to our taste. The place actually felt like home but with the upgrades my husband and I had been talking about undertaking in our own home -the spa outside, the stream shower and other nice touches here and there. Our suite had a private back patio with a hot tub with the soothing sound of the fountain lulling us further to bliss. There were just numerous nooks and crannies that begged to be discovered and enjoyed inside and outside our quarters. The groundâ€™s landscaping and structures blended harmoniously in a very low key fashion â€“ it was a very restful sight that was a prelude to de-cluttering the mind and leaving behind all your woes and work stressors. The two bicycles by the door were among the touches that underscored eco consciousness â€“ back to nature and simple times. We didnâ€™t expect this treat but we were given a welcome wine bottle and cheese plate which we availed of outside the patio â€“ yum! Shortly after, the kiddo was eager to swim after playing planes, trains and automobiles for over 7 hours. On the way to the pool, my husband and daughter played one round of bocce which my daughter actually won since she had a softer touch - hehe. We then went swimming in the children area â€“ they had a few floaties lying around and my daughter had fun stacking them and pretending she was in a sea plane rescuing other shipwrecked floaties - and here I thought she was tired of traveling. My husband and I swam and lounged enjoying the wonderfully cool weather â€“ we came from Austinâ€™s 96 to 106 degree heat blast. The lady who took care of our drinks was prompt and attentive though we really didnâ€™t stay too long as it was starting to get late. We did have a chance to walk around the premises â€“ that in itself was pretty relaxing as well. A few couples riding their bikes passed us by. Back in our unit, we soaked for about half an hour in the spa and tried the steam shower â€“ very soothing with the pebbles massaging the soles of our feet. The turn down service was great as well â€“ next thing we knew the sofa was turned into a bed with our child snugly tucked in watching TV, the fireplace was burning and life was good. And the robes â€“ WOW it was like being cocooned in pillows â€“ soo soft and heavenly. Hubby was so nice to give his up to my daughter and she wore hers the entire night and walked around like a snow empress. We would have loved to have made reservations at the Solbar but we instead decided to venture out for meals as we liked walking around town and sampling local eateries and pubs. Had a very pleasant meal at the Hydro Grill and enjoyed the local brew. I tried the pomegranate beer â€“ that was pleasantly refreshing and my husband like his beer as well. The food was also very good. The place we had breakfast at the following day was not very memorable. I did get my hour and a half of self-pampering at the spa where I had ample time to check in, unwind in the steam room and mineral pool before and after my 50 minute shiatsu and Swedish massage. I had scheduled it an hour before our check out from the resort. That experience, though short-lived, would be my personal favorite. My â€˜Calgon take me awayâ€™ moment â€“ my therapist was really great and I must have been reduced to melted goo on that massage table as I had a hard time peeling myself off - I wished for time to just stand still. Checkout was fast, hassle free. On our way out we saw a riotous color of Lambourginis neatly parked in a row at the lot â€“ you donâ€™t see that every day! Overall, the stay just felt so short - Solage really should be enjoyed at a more leisurely pace, two or more nights would be preferable especially for first timers to the Calistoga area. I wished to avail more of the spa services, the highly rated Solbar and ventured to some of the local wineries but alas we had a long travel to Monterey for our next destination. It felt like we ordered a sampler plate when everything should have been savored as entrees. But I guess that is what next time is for.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: BettyWalnutCreek
Reviews.Content: The food and service is wonderful! I have visted my highend hotels and nothing matched the service that we received at solage! Everyone was so pleasant and happy to assist you. The food at Solage was wonderful, you must try the lemon ricotta pancakes for breakfast and the soft taco's for lunch pared with a mojito!!! The Best Mojito I have ever had, filled with mint and not to sweet. Our cottage was decoracted with eco friendly touches and tastefully done. The cottages are set within a beautifully landscaped grounds.

Reviews.Title: “Another rave for Solage”
Reviews.Author: mcnuttle
Reviews.Content: If you're not convinced from all the high praising reviews here's another...Of all the places I've stayed in wine country, this is at the top of the list. They truly understand "service" and every encounter we had with the staff and facilities proved that someone is doing a fine job setting a high standard. The rooms are immaculate with a clean, modern design with everything you'd expect at a five star resort. Love the cottage style layout (nobody above or below). The pool...... man o' man! If you're a swimmer, you're gonna love it. 40 meters in length. Unbelievable! Almost double the length of a standard Olympic sized-pool. Not too heavy on the chlorine, either. Lap swimming at it's finest! And they have a separate kiddie pool. So, no screaming kids or leaking diapers in the water. :) Ditto for the gym. Nice facility with quality equipment. And an incentive to work off all the wine and dinners... The spa is beautifully designed. Serene. Did the couples mud slide and it was a trip! Not a standard mud bath at all. Blissed out to the max. Only gripe: had read complaints about the landscaping and thought, someone's being a persnickety ----, but I have to agree. Our patio had no privacy and looked out on to dried-out mulch with minimal, small plantings. I don't think this is a case of waiting for maturing growth. It'll still be sparse. In this verdant valley? Add some plantings to form a hedge around the outdoor spaces (some units have that, but not many). Also, we were there Tues. - Fri., it was definitely not full capacity, and mellow just the way I like it. Wonder what the place would be like if it were totally booked... But, we'll definitely return to find out. Final note: if you arrive late like we did and head into Calistoga expecting to get some dinner, every place will be closed around nine on a Tuesday night. Didn't help that Solage stops room service at nine, as well. Almost knocked off a star for the limited room service hours and landscaping, but it's rare for me to leave a hotel feeling so satisfied, I couldn't.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful elegant retreat”
Reviews.Author: WPS-76
Reviews.Content: We recently spent two nights at Solage in Calistoga. I took advantage of an online deal -- $350/night for a Vega king studio, including breakfast for two each morning. I highly recommend this hotel for a relaxing weekend get-away. From the moment we arrived, the service was impeccable: the front desk had fresh mint lemonade for us on arrival; we were shown to our room by a bellboy who walked us through the room's amenities; we used the concierge to book several wine tastings (do not miss Larkmead or Schramsberg!). Our room was fantastic - very modern, super comfortable bed, huge pebble-floor shower, iPod dock that played our music on our semi-private patio. And despite the July heat, we did use the bikes to visit two nearby wineries! Small details like the fresh minted water with turn down service were very nice. We also spent a few hours each day at the pool which was relaxing and fun -- it has a bit of a Miami feel to it with entertaining people-watching and great drinks -- but still quiet and relaxing. I spent one morning at the spa -- loved the Mudslide! Highly recommend it. I wish I had realized I would be applying the mud myself (you can ask for help) b/c I would have made my boyfriend come along also for a couples one. After the mud, you soak in a bath of Calistoga mineral water for 20 minutes, then a "relaxation" chair for 20 minutes. I could have skipped the chair... In addition to two breakfasts at Solbar (not for those without an appetite!), we had dinner one night at Solbar. The food, the patio, the wine, the service -- everything was excellent. I would definitely recommend Solage to someone who is hoping to avoid the Disneyland-feel of Napa. There are many fantastic wineries (Larkmead, August Briggs, Twomey, Clos Pegase) within a few minutes that are far less crowded and serve great wine. The vintners are thrilled to talk to people and show you around the vineyards. Plus - all the great restaurants in Yountville and St. Helena are easily accessible.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise has come home!”
Reviews.Author: RhiannaSanford
Reviews.Content: The drive from the airport is absolutely breathtaking almost as if to prepare you for arriving at Solage Calistoga in it's stunning location in this pristine, awe inspiring setting of the Palisade Mountains that has a way of stopping time in it's tracks. I was greeted as if I had finally made it home and my friends were waiting for me embracing me with every comfort possible. The concierge service is top of the line providing for your every whim with the utmost care and professional attention. The meticulous consideration to details makes for a truly impassioned vacation setting even tucking your mind in at days end with a closing thought to inspire your restful sleep. But not before you've experienced Solbar, their premier draw with it's unprecedented and innovative menu, food only dreams could conjure, rightfully earning a Michelin Star. Solage has seamlessly integrated it's resort into the community giving it a family friendly feel that spoils and pampers even the pickiest of adventurers. From day hikes, bike rides, pool side dining, local wine tastings, luxuriously tempting spa treatments with private geo-thermal pools and a fully accessible complimentary fitness schedule in their state of the art movement studio and well equipped gym you simply have nothing to want. Solage is unpretentious in it's setting and decadent in it's delivery. Paradise at your fingertips!

Reviews.Title: “Stuffing amazingly attentive and thoughtful service into the hip package Napa has never before had.”
Reviews.Author: WRB039
Reviews.Content: I love staying here for so many reasons. The setting is contemporary, open, airy and just puts one at ease. The service staff takes this and runs with it as every need is anticipated and delivered with a smile. The rooms are spacious, thoughtfully composed and super comfortable. And then of course there is Solbar - the restaurant where I eat more frequently than anywhere else in Napa - love it.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing & Refreshing”
Reviews.Author: maw8
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a second time in a year. We love the place. It's service is outstanding all the way from the greeters when we drove up to the guy who delivered a new box of tissues about 2 minutes after I requested it. We loved the patio furniture on our porch to sit outside and read in the quiet and tranquil atmosphere. We took the retro bikes 1/4 mile away and did a hike for an hour up a local peak -- Oat Creek Preserve or something like that. It was wonderful and so close! We ate breakfast both days at Solbar. The food was creative and very yummy. They were more than willing to split our breakfast entrees and our fruit plate was bursting with local berries and all sorts of things. As we drove up we were able to work with Jason, the concierge, to book appointments at local wineries at the last minute. Jason was awesome and guided us to some great tours and got tasting fees waived at some places too. Very nice. Our only glitch was that there's only Jason and he can only work 5 days a week. Not sure why they don't have a backup but he sure is AWESOME! We also at at JoLi and Barolo in town. Totally fantastic meal at JoLe!! Barolo was enjoyable but if you only have one place to eat, do JoLe but you must have reservations! On reading the recent (and only) bad review on Solage I really don't understand what the person was talking about. The hotel is eco-friendly with drought tolerant grasses all over the property. I didn't notice any dead plants and there were workers replanting a tree but that's all we saw. Our room was very quiet as was the neighborhood in general. Maybe asking for a room at the back of the property would have worked for them but, who knows. We did use the fitness center and I took a pilates class the last stay. The facility is wonderful. If you are interested in their classes call ahead to check the schedule. We booked a wine tour that conflicted with a free pilates reformer class that I would have liked to take. Hardly any resorts have free good classes like that! My pilates mat class the year before was great but they didn't offer it this week.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay”
Reviews.Author: ksamwell
Reviews.Content: I could go on an on about this hotel...we were there on honeymoon for only 2 nights, but wish it could have been more. We were upgraded on arrival and from there on in were treated extremely well. The room was gorgeous; had a seperate living room with fireplace and fenced off garden with a private whirl pool and table and chairs. The bathroom was huge and had all the things you could need in a room. Hairdryer, shampoo, conditioner etc. Bed was huge and extremely comfortable and we loved that we could plug our ipod in. Food at solage was excellent too. We only had dinner there one night, but it was absolutely top class. The service was pretty good, but we have experienced better. It was so much fun to have the bikes. We loved that as we cycled to the old faithful geyesr, which was fun. The pool was stunning and the food and drink around the pool was equally as nice. None of this was cheap, but then again we were expecting this. My new husband and i did the mud bath spa and had such fun. Really worth it. All in all and expensive little trip, but absolutely worth it. We really hope to go back someday.

Reviews.Title: “Eco-friendly hotel/spa with a laid-back, cool vibe”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl521
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a long weekend at Solage Calistoga. Although we'd been to Napa several times in the past, this was our first stay in Calistoga. Solage was great! It is more low-key and eco-friendly than it's ultra luxurious sister property, Auberge du Soleil. Rooms are quite large, more like casitas. Each "casita" has its own terrace with lounge furniture and even comes with unlimited use of two free retro bicycles. There are a number of wineries within biking distance. If the weather permits, you MUST take advantage of this. The hotel restaurant is fantastic. Breakfast is NOT to be missed. Dinner is also quite good. The proverbial icing on the cake is the hotel's spa. The property (and much of Calistoga itself) sits on a thermal hot spring. All spa services come with use of the hotel's thermal pool. WOW. During our stay, my husband and I would lounge in the property's outdoor bar/courtyard area. You can order nibbles and, of course, wine, while you play a game of bocce in one of two bocce courts. Very cool! The vibe at the hotel is eco-conscious and laid-back, yet trendy and stylish, with what appears to be a cool, urban clientele. Even the kids were stylish. We were very impressed with the hotel and will absolutely return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “What a beautiful and delightful experience!”
Reviews.Author: sundance168
Reviews.Content: Our travel agency specializes in high end pet priendly accommodations. We were delighted to stay at Solage, a fairly new pet friendly resort within walking distance to Calistoga. The individual rooms are set amongst a beautiful, serene landscaping. The spa is rated number one in the country, and for good reason. The onsite restaurant, SolBar is a lovely place for dinner, especially outside where your pooch is also welcome, and the food is exceptional. ( The proximity to Calistoga is also great for those who don't want to splurge on a Michelin rated restaurant every night.). The pools are beautiful and we love the added touch that the children's pool is separate. 2 bicycles are provided for each unit, which is so much fun. Our room was equipped with a big comfy bed for the dog (and one for ourselves), as well as dog bowls (water was also provided at the restaurant for the dog.) We especially appreciated and applaud Solage's "green" efforts. The staff are warm and inviting and were very friendly to our golden retriever. All in all it was a wonderful experience and we hope to go back often!

Reviews.Title: “Abolute WORST.... STAY AWAY!”
Reviews.Author: Travel-Well-000
Reviews.Content: The worst service, the worst attitude,.... At check out, they tried to charge us more for room by 30%. When provided the proof of the rate that we had booked, the rudeness just got worse. STAY AWAY from this place. They simply lied and insulted the guests. While in line for check out, heard another argument over rates between the rude front gate employee and an older lady. The property is in tough shape with cheap plastic furniture on patios, and the landscape is covered by weeds and dead plants. Not a pretty sight. You can hear the loud noise of care engines from nearby race track till late night like jet engines. No sleeping before 11 p.m. The house keeping pounds on the door before 9 a.m. Staff is young perhaps high school age from the area towns with no clue about hotel, restaurant, or hospitality industry.

Reviews.Title: “Great eco-friendly property, restaurant, but needs some service improvement”
Reviews.Author: MakeItRight4Traveler
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at Solage and my full review and photos are posted here: http://www.travelupgradeguide.com/calistoga-ca.html Solage, Calistoga, CA I just returned from a 5-day trip to Calistoga in Californiaâ€™s Napa Valley. Before we took this journey we began our research under a general sense of wanting to visit the CA wine country, including Napa and Sonoma. As we dug deeper into hotels, wine tours, and other options, Calistoga became the obvious destination, and the Solage Calistoga Resort was clearly our best choice of hotels. We were looking for accommodations on the higher end of the luxury spectrum, conveniently situated near the wineries we wanted to visit, within walking distance of nearby a town, and potentially a spa. We reviewed and called the following hotels in the area: 1. Heraldsburg Hotel â€“ http://www.hotelhealdsburg.com/ 2. El Dorado Hotel â€“ http://www.eldoradosonoma.com/el_dorado_hotel.html/ 3. Solage Calistoga â€“ http://www.solagecalistoga.com/ 4. Harvest Inn â€“ http://www.harvestinn.com/ All these properties had unique aspects, such as being in a downtown area, acceptable rates (around $195), and well-reviewed. Nonetheless, most didnâ€™t have the room configuration or availability for the dates we were interested in (apparently, April/May is a popular time for weddings in this part of CA). In the end, Solage was the only hotel that was able to accommodate our needs. The hotel reviewed well on TripAdvisor and other travel sites, but what really impressed me was the reservation process. I spoke with a wonderful reservation specialist, Hallie Spahr (hspahr@solagecalistoga.com), who was incredibly patient while she took care to understand the nature of our trip, identify the exact experience we were looking for, and discuss in great depth the location of the hotel (Northern Napa). Hallie made sure to point out special attributes of Solage such as their Michelin-starred restaurant, and the fact that their spa is rated #1 America and Caribbean and #10 in the World by Conde Nast; it is also rated the #2 Spa Resort and #11 Resort U.S. and Canada by Travel + Leisure Magazine. I was impressed that Hallie wanted to know if we were celebrating anything special and what our arrival time may be, so that she could secure dinner reservations for our first night to ensure we didnâ€™t go hungry on arrival! I was very impressed with her professionalism at the booking, and again later with her correspondence regarding any further questions we had. We flew into San Francisco around 9pm, and the night-time drive to Calistoga took about 2 hours, as there wasnâ€™t much traffic. When we arrived around 11pm, Kevin at the front desk was more than friendly and welcoming, ensuring we felt very well taken care of. Due to our flight delays, we unfortunately missed our dinner reservation; upon seeing our disappointment, Kevin rushed over to the bar to get us a bottle of wine right before it closed. After a long journey, we were enormously grateful to Kevin! Our room was spectacular. We stayed in the Atlas Studio which was absolutely wonderful with breathtaking views of the pool while being very close to the restaurant. The room was immaculate, very well appointed in a modern yet comfortable style, with a definite luxurious feel. We were very happy to rest comfortably in feathery down beds. Some of the best features of our room were: 1. We really liked the eco-friendly approach of refilling Solage glass water bottles instead of supplying daily plastic water bottles. The mint leaves in our water were very refreshing and provided a nice touch. 2. Along the same eco-friendly note, we appreciated the large containers of shower gel, shampoo, and conditioner instead of the traditional small, plastic, single use containers. 3. The bathrobes were simply heavenly!! After traveling around the world and experiencing some very lovely bathrobes, I can easily say these were by far the most luxurious, thick, soft, enveloping bathrobes Iâ€™ve ever experienced. Just putting them on and sitting on our patio made us feel restored. 4. Kudos to the housekeeping staff for always keeping our room exceptionally clean and welcoming. Great job! We spent our next 2 days we wine tasting and touring vineyards. I will go into details of those visits in my next column. For now, let me just say we had a great time and enjoyed the opportunity to experience a variety of winemaking styles, grapes, and individuals at each location. Each morning before our wine tasting tours, we had a delicious breakfast at the hotel restaurant. Each server was exceptionally knowledgeable and friendly, but Raul earns my highest praise for his attentiveness to our dining experience. Still, thanks should go to all the restaurant crew for their great job. Solage has a beautiful pool and we chose to sit by it couple of times to enjoy the view while we collected and recounted our memories of the day. We did have a disappointment during one of these visits when we ordered a drink, then were unable to get the waitressâ€™s attention and finally had to settle our bill directly with the bartender. While we certainly felt that flat 20% gratuity added by Solage was unjustified for such exceptionally unreliable service, we chose not to focus on the negative but instead on the continued enjoyment of the trip. Sadly this was not to be, as a few minutes after we returned to the room, we got a call from our waitress asking why we didnâ€™t pay her and why we left the pool without settling the bill! After far too much dialog explaining that due to her lack of attentiveness to her job we had to settle it at the pool bar (along with the fact that her colleagues should have communicated this to her), she eventually released us from the conversation of mistrust and mutual embarrassment. On our final day, we made spa appointments, as we simply had to experience the award-winning spa at Solage. We had 1 body massage and a combination of a facial and a foot massage. The spa facility is very nice, open with beautiful grounds that are separate enough from the main hotel/pool area for some peace and quiet. While the check in process was unusually fast for a spa, we were able to get into the more relaxed mood once in the waiting area. The therapists were wonderful. Both were very calm, kind, and expert in their respective areas. The Calistoga area is known for their mineral water (there is actually a water bottling facility down the road) and the spa offers clothing optional menâ€™s and womenâ€™s mineral water, hot and cold pools, and a co-ed pool in the spa area. While smaller than expected, I really liked the mineral water pools. The co-ed spa pool was also very pleasant, and the grounds well envisioned and maintained. The only issue we experienced was when ordering poolside drinks (again!) with a snack. For clarity, the spa pool is only available to spa guests, meaning if you are having a spa treatment you are welcome to enjoy the pool before or after your appointment. Of course, in this case you are in your bathrobe or swimsuit either awaiting or following your spa treatment and generally donâ€™t have any valuables on you, just the locker key where all your belongings remain. As such, I was surprised when we were asked to provide a room number or a credit card in order to place our poolside order. We explained that we had just checked out a couple of hours ago, so no room number was available, but of course all of our credit card information was on file and easily accessible. After much discussion of how to retrieve this information, we were told that we simply must provide a credit card if we wanted to be served. You can imagine how aggravating and disappointing it is to be reduced to a conversation of having to go back to the locker to immediately pay a $30 bill after we just spent over $2,000 on the visit! The pool restaurant attendant explained how there is nothing she can do as â€œthe systemâ€� would not let her enter our order and how this is the processâ€¦on, on and on. While I understand systems and processes, this is not acceptable for a hotel that charges $500+ night, nor should it be my problem or concern how Solage systems or processes work. I am a guest, attempting to enjoy the spa pool after my spa treatments, and for the type of luxury establishment Solage attempts to be, I expect the back-office challenges to be solved without my involvement. In light of two disappointing pool experiences, Solage should definitely provide better training to their pool staff and empower them to make decisions that satisfy basic guest expectations of the caliber Solage aspires to be. All in all, other than a few poorly trained pool staff, the hotel was enjoyable. We loved the room, the mineral pools, and the restaurant experience. Still, Iâ€™m not sure I would return without some assurance that the few hassles we experienced would not be repeated. This is a growing opportunity for Solage to improve this one aspect of their business, and I certainly welcome any comments from its management as to steps that are being put in place to address this. Once that happens, I would absolutely be comfortable returning and recommending Solage to my faithful readers. http://www.travelupgradeguide.com/calistoga-ca.html

Reviews.Title: “false promotion for $100 resort coupon.”
Reviews.Author: happywanderer060
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the solage hotel last year when seeking a membership in their Spa. I live about 60miles away but was interested in weekend getaways. Last year I tried to go swimming in the evening as I passed through town but the showers member showers were out of order on that Sunday evening. This year they sent me a coupon for $100 to try to lure me back to the place. I took the coupon to the restaurant and they would not honor it, despite no statement (even in small print) that you had to stay at the hotel to get the deal.. Several other guests had been similarly misled according to the embarrased wait staff. Too bad, I am a professional with significant dicressionary iincomeand they can't get it right even though I would theoretically like to partake of their services.

Reviews.Title: “stay away... not worth your time and money”
Reviews.Author: supertrekker40
Reviews.Content: this is my second visit at the solage, with the first in sept 2007. i have to say that after 3 years, they still have not gotten their act together. oh and don't bother voicing your dissatisfactions with the manager, they don't care. he told me he will escalate my concerns and call me back with a satisfied resolution. it's been a week after i my visit and i've still haven't heard back from them - i'm not holding my breath!

Reviews.Title: “Stunning service in equally stunning setting”
Reviews.Author: TigerandT
Reviews.Content: Solage Calistoga is a peaceful haven from which to explore the famed Napa and Calistoga vineyards. Service is impeccable, and the rooms/chalets exceptionally comfortable and luxurious. Ensure you request to be away from the road though, as some teeter on the edge and are a little noisey. Your chalet comes equipped with two bikes, which is a great touch - so you can cruise noiselessly into Calistoga for dinner. Make sure you eat in SolBar once though - it is delicious. We stumbled across JoLe in Calistoga which is certainly worth a visit for dinner; fantastic food and some interesting characters.

Reviews.Title: “Just Ok”
Reviews.Author: BayAreaHappytraveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Solage for 2 nights. We stayed in a Mira studio that included a king bed, fireplace and stone floor shower. The studio was modern in design. There were things that we liked about this resort and things that we didn't like. Things that we liked: - Check-in was efficient and cups of warm chai tea were given to us during the check-in process. - The stone floor shower was beautiful. - The bed was comfortable and had plenty of pillows. - The linens were nice and plush. - The i-pod docking station was nice. - The shampoo and lotions were fabulous. - Solbar was a fabulous restaurant...great breakfast and dinner. -The spa was visually beautiful and I had a great pedicure. Dislikes: -The modern style of the room was a bit cold. I did not like the cement floor it was hard on the feet and the slippers were hidden in the closet (We did not find them until the last day). -We received turn down service.....this included a carafe of water, linens turned down on the bed, fresh towels and an inspirational quote placed on the bed. While all of this was great we would have really appreciated the carafe of water at check-in. For the amount of money you spend some chocolate would have been great at turn down. On our last night we didn't even receive turn down service. We had dinner at the Solbar restaurant and I guess we weren't gone long enough. If the resort was on there A game they would have taken note that we had a dinner reservation and made sure to come during that time. -Use of the mineral pools is available if you are receiving a spa treatment. It would have been nice to have access to the mineral pool if you were simply a guest of the resort. -I received a facial at the spa. When I woke up the next morning my face was beet red and blotchy. I returned to the spa that morning and spoke to a manager and they said sorry and sent me on my way. I called her when I got home and let her know that I was still in great discomfort and only then did she offer to refund my money. I was extremely disappointed. -The resort backs to a trailer park and a low income apartment complex. All in all Solage is a nice place. When I pay that kind of money to stay somewhere I look for small extra touches and this place just didn't have them.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful spa experience”
Reviews.Author: jerrySF
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend trip to Napa Valley. Visited Solage for the first time, and tried the Mud bath treatment. This was different than the traditional "plunge" treatments where you sit in whole mess of mud and more is packed on top of you. You begin your experience by saddling up to the Mud Bar and selecting your scent of choice. Your bartender then mixes your mud and hands it to you in a little pail. You will then be led to your mud huts, where you can apply and bake. (If visiting as a couple, make sure to request a couple's hut...no extra charge.) After you bake (the mud begins to harden) you'll be notified that it is time to shower off. Once you get all of the mud off (takes a while) you'll be led to your soak tub, full of mineral water. Next up is your relaxation room. This involves a funky chair that gets reclined to "zero gravity" and you're supposed to power nap. This part was kind of strange, but it might be just your taste. After that you can enjoy the pools, one co-ed, one clothing optional for men and one clothing optional for women. Highly recommend the spa.

Reviews.Title: “Would like to take home!”
Reviews.Author: i_love_cupcakes
Reviews.Content: The Solage was wonderful! We arrived early and went to the spa. We were treated very well and had a lovely experience. We hung out in the geo thermal pool before we had a mud treatment, followed by soaking baths and sound chairs. Although it was cold out, the robes they gave were sufficient and they had heat lamps and fires. After that we checked in and went to our room, which was very clean and modern and just loved the setup as well as the fireplace! We had dinner at the resort that night and let me tell you it was delicious! I thought the service was excellent, they were very attentive and knowledgeable! We also went swimming in the pool the next day, and had no problem. We rode the bikes to town and had a grand time looking at the vineyards on our way! We were close enough to all the vineyards we wanted to go to, so I loved the location. I may not review often, but I do if I have an outstanding (either way) experience!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Calioutdoors
Reviews.Content: We had an amazing time this past weekend with nothing short of amazing customer service. We arrived prior to check in at 1pm and although the room was not ready quite yet the receptionist told us to take full advantage of their facilities and they would come by with a key. We decided to go to their beautiful pool (which has a wonderful changing/shower room) and the receptionist arrived with the key just 30 min later! We took advantage of the spa service and then decided to retrieve our car so we could check the room out. The valet told us that he had already delivered he car to our cabana...perfect! The cabana was beautiful, comfy, secluded, cozy and they unloaded our suitcases in our room. We ventured to the spa for a couples massage. The spa is also wonderful and we took advantage of their rejuvenation relaxation package. A spatini, wonderful (deep deep tissue massage), and the mineral pools at dusk. We road the bikes (which are complementary outside each cabana) for a stroll through the so cute city of Calistoga. I had an amazing time and although they couldn't grant us late check-out the day we left they told us that we should definitely take full advantage of their facilities for the rest of the day...and we sure did!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional!”
Reviews.Author: LaraCroftSeattle_WA
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed a The Solage for 3 days. It was our first getaway affer our son Max was born 6 months ago. From the moment we arrived we were treated like royalty - the valet, the receptionists, the bartender, even the maid staff provided exceptional service. I was nervous about leaving Max for the first time but the moment I arrived at The Solage I knew we made the right choice. The resort has a feeling subdued elegance - not stuffy but very relaxing, clean and absolutely beautiful. The bikes for guests are a wonderful addition. Thank you Solage! We decided to make this a yearly getaway trip.

Reviews.Title: “It grows on you”
Reviews.Author: CAishome
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at Solage last August. At first, the layout of the resort and the location was not super appealing. But over the course of the visit, we really came to enjoy the whole experience quite a bit. The pool area is great; wonderful drink and food service (fish tacos to die for!) and relaxing (although we are not big fans of piped in music on a continual basis at resorts). Our room was good for the 4 of us, loved the bathroom area and we were definitely comfortable, but not thinking 'wow', but definitely clean, nice, cool. Our breakfasts at Solbar were really good and it was fun to do a little cruising on the bikes. I do agree that if you are not from the Bay Area and want the true wine country experience, you may not quite feel like the setting of Solage provides that, perhaps. As Bay Area residents, we didn't mind that and there is a lot going for this resort in terms of service, price point, good food and relaxation. We loved our dinner at JoLe just a quick 5 minute drive in downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Simply cozy...”
Reviews.Author: JCarlson1
Reviews.Content: A very quaint, yet upscale and beautiful resort in Calistoga. Great location very close to wonderful wineries such an Frank Family Vineyards. The service was exceptional, the individual cottages were simple, yet elegant. The porch was amazing, every amenity you could desire at a hotel. Beautiful swimming pool. This is a very unique resort and I would highly suggest it!

Reviews.Title: “Luxe wine country accommodations that are kid & dog friendly”
Reviews.Author: holuko
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Solage with two small kids, dog, and my in-laws for Thanksgiving. Could've been a recipe for disaster but everyone had a great time. There's a separate kids/family pool and hot tub, enough open space on the property for the kids and dog to run around, and very friendly staff at Solage. Check-in was a breeze--we requested and got an early check-in with two "suites" right next door to each other. Rooms were really spacious and had a glorious indoor-outdoor feel. Bathroom products are what they use in the spa and are provided in large (eco-friendly) pump dispensers. Solbar restaurant is very good, but pricey, and the patio section is dog-friendly so you can dine alfresco with your pup. Didn't try the spa, unfortunately. Am trying to think of something negative to say but honestly we all quite enjoyed ourselves, and for this family that's quite an endorsement!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely resort that's a great value for the area”
Reviews.Author: mickeyjr
Reviews.Content: One of our top 2 resorts in the Napa Valley, and we've been to quite a few. Beautiful facilities (geothermal 100 degree pool under the stars...130 foot adult swimming pool), great restaurant and friendly staff. Facility is within walking distance to Calistoga but feels very secluded. Complimentary cruiser bikes for each room. Everything that you could want in a resort.

Reviews.Title: “Seclusion”
Reviews.Author: northamericatourist
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 3 day week-end at the Solage Calistoga with my fiance. We were very pleased with the property, fairly new, clean, quiet, and very relaxing. We ate a few meals at the Solage restaurant Solbar and the food was excellent and the service was good. I liked this location because it was very quiet and peaceful, plus you are very close in proximity to lots of great wineries. Every morning was started out with a workout in the fitness room which had some of the nicest exercise equipment on the market today. A nice feature in the rooms were having a coffee machine with fresh coffee grinds. If and when we come back up to Napa Valley this is where we will stay, if of course we can get a decent rate.

Reviews.Title: “upscale, modern ecofriendly place with fabulous spa”
Reviews.Author: JustPeg
Reviews.Content: We'd Really Recommend this place. we were away for a girls get-away. this small resort is just around the corner from the one-street downtown of Calistoga, though Solage is relaxing enough that you wouldn't have to leave much: really a fantastic spa, and a nice big pool with lots of lounging. the restaurant was great for lunch (going tonight for dinner), very nice chef named Brandon. we took there cruiser bikes out for some wine tasting close by, and to the Castello di Amarosa (worth a stop). we spent a whole afternoon in the spa, and had and really recommend the Mud Slide treatment. No complaints. everyone was very helpful and polite in a non-annoying way.

Reviews.Title: “Refreshing new twist in Wine Country”
Reviews.Author: tammigop
Reviews.Content: We had an amazing 3 day/2night stay at Solage! Our room wasn't quite ready when we showed up, but I barely sat down at SolBar when we were notified that our room was all set! We were upgraded to an Adara Studio, which is located at the north end of the property, which is of course beautiful, but also backs up to a loud apartment complex with MANY children... luckily, this complex was behind our cottage, and not in front... but it was really weird to see it in such plain sight at such a high end resort. Nonetheless, there were two bikes parked out front for our use on property and in the neighboring areas...which is REALLY cool. The room is so different than what I'm used to in the Valley... but it was beautiful... a big light and airy studio ...the pebble floor shower is beautiful, and the tub was great! We hit the spa immediately after checking in and can't say enough about it- we did the "couples are suite" package...which includes the mudslide treatment and an hour long couples massage. All I can say is WOW. What a luxurious experience...and after the treatment was over, we used the bathhouse facilities ... there is a main pool that requires a bathing suit, and then two separate areas that are clothing optional for men and women... I was SO lucky...I had this entire area to myself!! The hot mineral pool was SO relaxing, as was the eucalyptus steam room- it was VERY hot and smelled so great! The cold plunge was refreshing, as was the al fresco shower (complete with body wash and shampoo and conditioner). I spent about an hour out there.. it was chilly, but it didn't matter at all!! We had dinner at SolBar, and that was a great experience. I really liked how they split the menu into "lighter" dishes and "hearty" dishes... really helped make those important dining decisions! Husband had the homemade chicken soup, ahi tuna with bacon and the profiteroles for dessert , I had the sea salt flatbread and the chickpea stew with vanilla ice cream. All were delicious... dinner was good- but breakfast was OUTSTANDING! From the coffee & juice to the sausage, bacon and corned beef hash- it was seriously indulgent, but soooo good!! We also hit up Cafe Sarafornia in Calistoga one morning... and the food there was also really great! All in all- what a great place to stay... we will most definitely be back- and SOON!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible, kind service in a wonderful casual chic earthy surroundings”
Reviews.Author: Partyplanner11
Reviews.Content: I brought my husband here for his 35th birthday. It was a surprise to him but all the staff at Solage knew. They were unbelievably kind and welcoming. Tyson, the concierge organized dinner reservations at Martini House for us (which was incredible by the way). The spa services were wonderful. We loved that the rooms are each there own little cottage with 2 comfortable cruiser bikes. The rooms are comfortable and well furnished in a simple, contemporary way, but not luxurious. High-end, but not over-the-top. The town of Calistoga is a 4 minute bike ride away and so cute and friendly. Everything about Solage pleased us and we will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, luxurious and yet so down to earth”
Reviews.Author: 3dogsinthecountry
Reviews.Content: 4 night stay at Solage was idyllic. Beautiful accomodations, luxurious and yet unpretentious. Everyone we encountered provided top-notch service. Spa was fabulous with excellent services, especially massage (and pina colada scrub, don't miss it!). Restaurant fantastic. Concierge extremely helpful and great restaurant recommendations. Enjoyed the bikes provided and the trip next door to Lava Vine vineyard. Definitely living up to the Michelin star rating. We will be back next year same time.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: dalestech
Reviews.Content: Great rooms. Loved the cruiser bikes and used them every day. Huge swimming pool and only my husband and I seemed to use it. Great service from the front desk who organised an amazing wine visit for us. Our only complaint was the huge portions in the restaurant. overfacing. Wonderful room service breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Resort, Top Notch Service - Booked a large group and had NO PROBLEM”
Reviews.Author: tuckerSanFrancisco
Reviews.Content: I am an EA in SF, and booked a group of 24 to stay the night, have spa treatments and visit wineries. They were helpful and resourceful and the service was ABOVE and BEYOND. We wanted for nothing. The place is gorgeous, clean, well designed. The food was AMAZING. What else is there to say?? If you need help with booking a large group, call Jacqi, Sarah, Tyson, Abby etc.. and they will make sure your stay is flawless and memorable. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as we expected”
Reviews.Author: mndnyc
Reviews.Content: To be fair, the hotel is physically lovely. The physical layout and rooms are very nice. Particularly for a family, the cottage with two rooms connected by a hallway was great. HOWEVER, the service was not up to snuff. We have prevously stayed at Calistoga Ranch which is owned by the same group and there the service was fanstastic. You felt like they would do anything for you..at Solage...not so much. In fact, you felt somtimes like you were annoying the staff. Parricularly, the concierge and front desk staff were just not that nice. There was only one exception, which was the woman behind the desk when we checked very late. In general though, the staff seemed young and inexperienced and therefore the service seemed abrupt. This was exremely disappointing given the ownership.

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it”
Reviews.Author: ejblue
Reviews.Content: Really are you joking... the prices for this glorified motel six. The only reason I didnt leave was the staff is so nice. So lets begin... TV didn't work (yes just like 1 star hotel) and they seemed ok with that - no transfer of rooms, no new tv, room service after 10pm - no one answers the phone, decor is cheap, no view, tree's etc. Food - i live in asia (the land of kale) why the h*ll would you put that on eggs bene? oh and no menu in the room so figure it our yourself. If the price was 200 a night - no problem but 700??? Shame on you. DONT DO IT! Auberge or Calistoga Ranch - not this place. But let me reiterate - the staff is GREAT the owner should be ashamed for his prices. And I feel like an idiot for paying it. Good Luck!

Reviews.Title: “SOLAGE = NO SOUL. STAY AWAY.”
Reviews.Author: skibikerundrinksleep
Reviews.Content: -Service is awful. Pool attendants ask you daily for your name and room number even when only 10 people go to the pool (like you jumped the fence). A local line cook remembered my breakfast sandwich the second time I went for no financial gain, but this hotel has no clue how to recognize guests even in the low early week period. Even worse, they make you daily prove your identify. It was our honeymoon and they knew ahead of time and did 0% for us $0.00. Don't expect even a glass of cheap champagne on the house or anything comped, not even half priced ap, etc. -An affordable housing community is right over the fence. They have their place, but not next people paying $750 a night on their honeymoon. If it is nice out, kids nightly scream and play games. IF you want to relax in peace at night, you will hear this noise in your outdoor space. -If you are social people, don't plan on staying here. Better off staying somewhere else. You have an easier time meeting people at local wineries and restaurants than here. No daily happy hour, nothing social planned, absolutely dead. But as stated above, without the sereneity and dead, what do you have? An overpriced hotel in a bad location with bad service. --Housekeeping twice walked in on us to turn down the room despite our shouts to go away and stay out. Not sure if she was hearing impaired or wanted to wrap up work and go home at 5:30, but annoying. --At checkout someone enjoyed a $50 breakfast on our tab. Another mistake, doubt it. I think the locals are onto the fact no one here knows what they are doing, so they see the number on the bikes in town and enjoy a breakfast on them. --Landscaping is terrible inside the private fences. Think rock garden, without the garden and just bland rocks and a couple of twigs as plants. I'm all for green landscaping, but have a cactus or something then. --Beware service charges. Walked up and bought $12 goggles by the pool and gave my room number. They tried to give us a bill for $19, the $12 was really $15 and there was a $4 service charge. seriously? how much did we pay for the room again? --bikes for each room are a nice touch. One of the very few positives about this resort. --The rooms on the inside are quite nice. If you are looking to roll around in bed, are willing to spend the money, and don't want to be bothered, this is your place. You'll get no service anyway. Ooops...they might walk in on you in the act. other than that.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay...”
Reviews.Author: wanderluster123
Reviews.Content: Pros: Restaurant: The restaurant is absolutely delicious!! Very low key, laid back and unpretentious. We had dinner at the restaurant one night, and the mushroom pasta and heirloom tomato salad there was phenomenal. It was light but flavorful and the ingredients were very fresh. I would say the restaurant was my favorite thing about the hotel. Bicycles: We loved that cruiser bicycles that come with each room. We biked around Calistoga one day and it was such a pleasant feeling. Rooms: We had the studio room, which looked exactly like the pictures on the hotel website. The room was comfortable, and the standing shower was nice and spacious, as was the sink area. I thought it was fine and functional. I liked that each room has its own patio with comfy chairs to lounge around on. Pool: Huge olympics sized pool, which I did not use, but seemed like a great spot to lazy around in the afternoon. Bathrobes: Most comfortable bathrobes hands down! They were lined with a super softt terrycotton that made me want to go out with it. Cons: Concierge: We had some issues with the concierge. For example we asked the concierge to make reservations at several restaurants and wineries upon check in but we had to remind them the next morning to do so. In one particular instance, concierge had told us we did not need to make reservations for lunch, but we were turned away upon arrival at the restaurant since it was completely fully booked. Rooms: Rooms are a bit dark because of the minimal motif and dark cement floor design. Maid Service: Overall the rooms were tidy and well maid; however, on one day housekeeping disregarded the "Do Not Disturb" sign on our door, and entered to clean it while we were having breakfast. We had put the sign on the door because we did not pack up all our belongings before leaving the room that day. Overall: Overall we had a good stay, but for the price, I would probably stay elsewhere next time. I would rather stay in Yountville or St. Helena as well to be closer to the wineries and restaurants as Calistoga is a bit further out. I will, however, definitely make a trip out to the Solage again for the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Wine country bliss”
Reviews.Author: GPA7
Reviews.Content: Good: 1. Great rooms, stylishly designed,a very comfortable bed and a nice terrace. 2. Nice toiletries for Mrs G. 3. Excellent, friendly, knowledgeable and welcoming staff. 4. Families and couples catered for very well with enough privacy and intimacy. 5. Superior Spa. 5* massage, facials and top products (Kate Somerville). Fair value. 6. Nice touch with bicycles for each villa. 7. Super hi-speed wi-fi in the room. Bad: 1. We weren't warned about dinner finishing at 9pm on Sunday and had to order from the bar menu! 2. We couldn't stay longer!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent & relaxing - favourite hotel of our California trip”
Reviews.Author: SurburbanMomof3
Reviews.Content: Having spent the previous week packing in as many sights as we could around the California coast, it was fabulous to come to the Solage Calistoga. As you arrive, it looks very unassuming, but the service and facilities were outstanding. Our little cottage was comfortable - perhaps that was the only slightly disappointing thing about the hotel - it felt a little gloomy & cold. Can't decide if that's because of the concrete floor or the muted shades of the decor but it could have a light and brighter feel. However that aside (and I really am nit-picking here!) , every thing else was fantastic. The pools are great - with 3 kids, we were based at the childrens one which was perfect and still felt attended to by the bar staff who brought chilled water for us without having to be asked. The adults pool (or from kids aged 12 up) was beautiful. We ate at the Sol Bar for both our meals here and they were delicious. I ate the chicken which was so tasty but simple prepared, that I am still thinking about it. The wine was excellent and we were there on a Monday where we were able to take advantage of the a half price offer for member vineyards so we had some really excellent Napa wine). Kids loved the breakfasts and every meal was taken out on the patio. The waiting staff were fantastic (kids are still talking about our waiter one evening who performed magic tricks).After dinner we played Boules which the children loved. Also took advantage of the Spa facilities and it was incredibly peaceful . All in all - a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Laid Back Luxury”
Reviews.Author: CalClan
Reviews.Content: Solage is an Auberge property which means it is incredibly high end yet unpretentious. Everything was perfect during our stay; we can't find anything wrong at this wonderful resort. * The property has everything you could want: two pools (adult and kids) with Calistoga's famous mineral water (food and beverage service, towels, water and private cabanas); beautiful and pampering spa; bright well equiped gym, yoga studio, complimentary exercise classes and complimentary bikes to cruise the neraby town and/or wineries; and best of all an outstanding restaurant. * Each stand alone cottage has an outdoor private patio, wonderful bath products, mini frig, coffee maker, utensils and wifi. They are large inside, "green" in design and very bright. You don't want to leave your cottage! * The staff is young, friendly and helpful. Everyone seems happy to work here. * The restaurant is unbelievable. We are from San Francisco area and used to excellent food, but this place still stands out. The food is unbelievably fresh - mostly grown nearby - and creatively delicious with nice portions. The Chef stopped by each table the evening we dined. We had breakfast and dinner and loved every item. * The location is ideal. You can walk/bike 5 minutes to the quaint town of Calistoga; hiking is across the street; numerous wineries abound, but lounging by the gorgeous pool sipping a beverage and enjoying a good book is also right there. We are already planning a return trip in a few months.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: bijlee
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here overnight on a spontaneous romantic getaway. What an incredible experience! I was not aware when I booked our stay that this resort had made #11 on Travel & Leisure's Top 50. Quite an accomplishment for a barely two year old property! The staff here makes you feel welcome the moment you arrive with a glass of fresh lemonade and an amazingly friendly demeanor. They are a green property, but that does not mean any kind of compromise on luxury...the rooms are cool and lovely- separate cabins with private patios, and the free bikes outside are a nice touch. The spa is abs. fabulous- we had the three step mud treatment in a couples room and a couples massage afterwards. Heaven!! Unfortunately we didn't get the chance to try out the all- mineral water pool inside the spa, though it was invitingly heated at a nice 90 degrees. We dined at Solbar and everyone was aware ahead of time that I was a vegetarian and bent over backwards to accomodate me. The chef (who was a sous chef at French Laundry prior to this) came out personally to ask if chicken broth was okay with me. The food and wine were to die for! The concierge not only promptly sent over information for a hot air balloon ride which I had requested, but a long handwritten note with all the relevant particulars. He seamlessly assisted with getting the reservations done with less than half a day's notice. At every touch point, we encountered unbelievably friendly and helpful service. We were barely there 24 hours, but will have memories for a lifetime...

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious, Modern Design, Eco-Friendly, and Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: spa_connaisseur
Reviews.Content: Just had a fabulous stay at Solage. What a unique place! A great modern design boutique resort and spa near near downtown Calistoga. LOVE the luxurious modern design of the rooms, very high end, love the concrete floors. Each cottage has their own little patio with lounge chairs, we spent a lot of time hanging out on the patio overlooking beautiful old oak trees. It felt very private. They have three pools, one is a mineral pool in the bathhouse by the spa, which was my favorite, and then a larger pool and a family pool over by the restaurant. Great workout facility, one of the best I have seen, even though I never actually used it, I liked knowing it was there just in case..... Also had a beautiful yoga studio next to the gym. Food was really amazing at Solbar. Unique very fresh California cuisine, and great atmosphere on outdoor lounge / patio and fire-pit. The restaurant also serves filtered water which I loved and so appreciate. They have cruiser bikes at every cottage, so you can cruise around town or the resort. Love that. They also allow dogs, we brought our two little Chihuahuas and they loved it. So nice to go on vacation and not have to leave them behind! I am a total purist when it comes to bath products, and Solage actually has really pure bath products in the rooms made by Sumbody - a great company. I travel a lot and can not think of a single time when I have ever used the products in hotel rooms because most are full of chemicals and preservatives. I always bring my own. I was so pleasantly surprised and to be honest a little shocked when I saw that they are using "Sumbody" products in the rooms and they really are actually all natural and pure. I am so impressed by the "little things" and Solage doesn't' miss a beat on those great little extravagant details. The spa also has an organic all natural line of facial products called Eminence, my absolute favorite skin care line ever. I usually don't get facials at resorts because most have products that are full of chemicals. Solage is definitely the most eco-frinedly resort I have been too. They have countless green aspects, one of my favorites was that instead of bringing plastic bottles of water to your room at night, they leave you a complimentary beautiful reusable glass bottle of filtered water with a beautiful sprig of mint in it for turn down service. Great touch, and I highly commend them for doing away with the plastic bottles, what a great idea. First resort I have stayed at that does this. That alone makes me want to go back. Had two fabulous massages while I was there at the spa and we also did the couples mud slide experience, which I highly recommend. Pure heaven. Just writing about it makes me want to go back. I have stayed at a lot of different places in Napa/ Sonoma/ Calistoga/ Wine Country and Solage (and Calistoga Ranch) are my two favorites, hands down.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Choice”
Reviews.Author: ilove2travel03
Reviews.Content: My friend and I went to Napa for a few days and stayed at Solage Calistoga. From the moment we arrived we were treated so well by the staff. The spa and mineral pools are amazing. The mud baths are a must! Also, this hotel has the best gym facilities I have ever seen, and I travel a lot. The gym had many treadmills, etc and then there was a pilates/yoga studio with 5-6 reformers which can be used in their complimentary classes (a rare find) and they have a power plate (an even more rare find). The food was really good. The portions were beyond generous. When we ordered lunch by the pool we were stunned by how large the order of fish tacos was and more important, the tacos were delicious. The service and food at Solbar was really good and I am still dreaming about the donut holes with blueberry compote. Truly, we had a great stay..

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely divine”
Reviews.Author: jeffslove
Reviews.Content: The stay was wonderful. The staff was very helpful by going above and beyond the call of duty to make us happy. The fitness instructor was awesome and the workout facility is top notch. The food in the restaurant is truly yummy and we even saw a celebrity at dinner. The Solage provides 2 bikes with every room and I felt like a 12 year old kid again on the bikes! The hotel, the staff and the food was absolutely divine, I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “What can I say, a fantastic place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Chrisb321
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Solage for one night during our Napa trip. Why only one night? Well the normal rates are $350 and up and we were not prepared to pay that much but I was able to use my free stay from the hotels.com program which allowed us to get the room for just the tax. We paid $31 a night for the Solage !!! Awesome !! The resort is just wonderful. The room was fantastic. A very modern studio with concrete flooring, fantastic walk in shower and beautiful patio. We used the complimentary beach cruiser bikes to get into the town (about half a mile away) for dinner and drinks that evening. The pool was wonderful and totally deserted. Not sure where everyone was. The reviews for this place are good for a reason and if you can get a night for $31 then do it!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best in Napa Valley!”
Reviews.Author: finetraveler0
Reviews.Content: We've been visiting the wine country for years now and have stayed at various different places, but after our last visit to Solage, this is now our favorite. Each spacious room/unit is detached with plenty of privacy, private outdoor patio with serene views, wonderful bathrooms, access to our own bicycles and excellent service. This is truly a wonderful place with amazing vws, huge pool, nice restaurant and ideal location. For the price, I'd say it's the best in all of the valley. Book your stay and you'll be extremely satisfied!

Reviews.Title: “The ultimate trip of our dreams !”
Reviews.Author: 1nurse
Reviews.Content: I visited this excellent resort with my friend and my daughter . We had a fabulous time ! The service was 5 star and the experience spectacular. The Spa was "to die for" and the mud bath was unbelievable . We could not have had a better time . We all experienced different Spa offerings and one was better then another. We thought we had experienced the best and then it was outdone. The staff could not have been any more courteous. We had the experience of a lifetime !

Reviews.Title: “Lovely New Resort”
Reviews.Author: TravelBugBitten99
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our anniversary getaway. We took our 3 year old son. The grounds and the cottages are very, very nice. I read nearly all the reviews prior to booking our reservations. I noticed that most of the negative reviews were from the resort's first guests when it opened nearly 2 years ago. Now that the landscape has matured somewhat and the staff and service have been fine-tuned, I think many of those who were dismayed with their stay would find a different experience altogether if they were to give it another chance. It is a mite on the pricey side but there are definitely a lot of perks to staying here. Besides the gorgeous grounds, facilities and attentive staff, they supply complimentary cruisers, free wifi, iPod dock, and porches with each cottage. The food was good although, again, pricey.
